meanings.sent1: The teacher was expulsing the troublemaker from the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The security guard was expulsing the intruder from the premises.
meanings.sent3: The cat was expulsing the mouse from its territory.
meanings.sent4: The storm was expulsing leaves from the trees with its strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The vacuum cleaner was expulsing dust from the carpet effectively.

meanings.definition: The act of expelling or ejecting
meanings.sent1: The expulsing of the student was necessary to maintain order.
meanings.sent2: The expulsing of air from the balloon made it deflate.
meanings.sent3: The expulsing of confetti at the party added to the festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The expulsing of water from the hose was done with a strong squeeze.
meanings.sent5: The expulsing of smoke from the chimney signaled that the fire was lit.

meanings.definition: The process of removing or eliminating
meanings.sent1: The expulsing of toxins from the body is important for good health.
meanings.sent2: The expulsing of outdated policies led to a more efficient system.
meanings.sent3: The expulsing of errors from the report improved its accuracy.
meanings.sent4: The expulsing of weeds from the garden allowed the flowers to thrive.
meanings.sent5: The expulsing of old furniture made room for new pieces in the house.
